id: A strategy may involve activities that are needed in order to achieve specific goals or objectives. It may take into account one or more policies or any number of restrictions and constraints.
name: A strategy may involve activities that are needed in order to achieve specific goals or objectives. It may take into account one or more policies or any number of restrictions and constraints.

id: Objectives.rdf version of the ontology was modified to use the Commons Ontology Library (Commons) Annotation Vocabulary rather than the OMG's Specification Metadata vocabulary and eliminate unnecessary references to LCC.
name: Objectives.rdf version of the ontology was modified to use the Commons Ontology Library (Commons) Annotation Vocabulary rather than the OMG's Specification Metadata vocabulary and eliminate unnecessary references to LCC.

id: Objectives.rdf version of this ontology was modified to add the property 'has strategy' for use in linking to pricing, quotation, distribution, delivery, and other strategies or methods.
name: Objectives.rdf version of this ontology was modified to add the property 'has strategy' for use in linking to pricing, quotation, distribution, delivery, and other strategies or methods.

id: state of affairs and coordinated set of activities designed to obtain benefits not available from managing them individually
name: state of affairs and coordinated set of activities designed to obtain benefits not available from managing them individually

id: Objectives.rdf version of this ontology was modified to integrate concepts such as distribution and sales strategy, and to eliminate duplication of concepts in LCC.
name: Objectives.rdf version of this ontology was modified to integrate concepts such as distribution and sales strategy, and to eliminate duplication of concepts in LCC.

id: Objectives.rdf version of this ontology was modified to address hygiene issues with respect to text formatting.
name: Objectives.rdf version of this ontology was modified to address hygiene issues with respect to text formatting.

id: state of affairs and unique and temporary organization, designed to deliver a tangible output
name: state of affairs and unique and temporary organization, designed to deliver a tangible output

id: objective that reflects the strategic goals and direction of a business within a time frame and available resources
name: objective that reflects the strategic goals and direction of a business within a time frame and available resources

id: plan or method for achieving a specific goal, objective, solution or outcome
name: plan or method for achieving a specific goal, objective, solution or outcome

id:
ontology structure

name:
ontology structure

id: objective that reflects the strategic financial goals and direction of a party within a time frame and available resources
name: objective that reflects the strategic financial goals and direction of a party within a time frame and available resources

id: contextual designation for a program within the context in which that program is administered
name: contextual designation for a program within the context in which that program is administered

id: A project has a fixed - generally fairly short - timeframe, and a project manager is responsible for delivering the output on time and on budget.
name: A project has a fixed - generally fairly short - timeframe, and a project manager is responsible for delivering the output on time and on budget.

id: Objectives.rdf version of this ontology was modified to add the concept of a program, required for IND but also to represent compliance, and other kinds of programs.
name: Objectives.rdf version of this ontology was modified to add the concept of a program, required for IND but also to represent compliance, and other kinds of programs.

id: This ontology defines concepts including goal, objective, program, and strategy. Objectives are defined as being distinct from goals, in that they constitute time limited and measurable targets which some entity may seek to attain in pursuit of its goals.
name: This ontology defines concepts including goal, objective, program, and strategy. Objectives are defined as being distinct from goals, in that they constitute time limited and measurable targets which some entity may seek to attain in pursuit of its goals.

id: The combination of investment objectives and risk tolerance are typically used to identify appropriate investment options.
name: The combination of investment objectives and risk tolerance are typically used to identify appropriate investment options.

id: sequence of characters uniquely identifying a specific project within the context in which that project or an overarching program is administered
name: sequence of characters uniquely identifying a specific project within the context in which that project or an overarching program is administered

id: Business objectives allow an organization to define its goals and direction. A company uses strategy and tactics at every level of its operation to achieve its objectives. These define the way a company allocates its resources and the strengths, weaknesses and opportunities it may have. Companies usually do not alter their objectives once they are implemented, unless changes in circumstances arise. Setting a clear course for the organization is key to its success.
name: Business objectives allow an organization to define its goals and direction. A company uses strategy and tactics at every level of its operation to achieve its objectives. These define the way a company allocates its resources and the strengths, weaknesses and opportunities it may have. Companies usually do not alter their objectives once they are implemented, unless changes in circumstances arise. Setting a clear course for the organization is key to its success.

id: financial objective used by an investor to determine whether or not a given potential investment is appropriate for themselves or on behalf of another party
name: financial objective used by an investor to determine whether or not a given potential investment is appropriate for themselves or on behalf of another party

id: relates something to a long-term, desired outcome
name: relates something to a long-term, desired outcome

id: Objectives.rdf version of this ontology was modified to integrate concepts such as investment objective, business objective, strategy, and related properties.
name: Objectives.rdf version of this ontology was modified to integrate concepts such as investment objective, business objective, strategy, and related properties.

id: Objectives.rdf version of this ontology was modified to use the Commons Ontology Library (Commons) rather than the OMG's Languages, Countries and Codes (LCC), eliminating redundancies in FIBO as appropriate.
name: Objectives.rdf version of this ontology was modified to use the Commons Ontology Library (Commons) rather than the OMG's Languages, Countries and Codes (LCC), eliminating redundancies in FIBO as appropriate.

id: In general, objectives are more specific and easier to measure than goals. Objectives are basic tools that underlie all planning and strategic activities. They serve as the basis for creating policy and evaluating performance. Some examples of business objectives include minimizing expenses, expanding internationally, or making a profit.
name: In general, objectives are more specific and easier to measure than goals. Objectives are basic tools that underlie all planning and strategic activities. They serve as the basis for creating policy and evaluating performance. Some examples of business objectives include minimizing expenses, expanding internationally, or making a profit.

id: strategy for selling something, including allocating resources to the sales process, reducing costs, and optimizing revenues
name: strategy for selling something, including allocating resources to the sales process, reducing costs, and optimizing revenues

id: sequence of characters uniquely identifying a specific program within the context in which that program is administered
name: sequence of characters uniquely identifying a specific program within the context in which that program is administered

id: relates something to a specific objective (result) that it aims to achieve within a time frame and with available resources
name: relates something to a specific objective (result) that it aims to achieve within a time frame and with available resources

id: strategy for achieving a specific business goal, objective, solution or outcome
name: strategy for achieving a specific business goal, objective, solution or outcome

id: Many people endeavor to reach goals within a finite time by setting deadlines.
name: Many people endeavor to reach goals within a finite time by setting deadlines.

id: short-term, quantitative, measurable result that a party seeks to attain in order to achieve its long-term goals
name: short-term, quantitative, measurable result that a party seeks to attain in order to achieve its long-term goals

id: strategy for making a product or service available, or for distributing funds, such as in the form of a dividend or coupon
name: strategy for making a product or service available, or for distributing funds, such as in the form of a dividend or coupon

id: Objectives.rdf version of this ontology was modified to add the concept of a project and related attributes (LOAN-169).
name: Objectives.rdf version of this ontology was modified to add the concept of a project and related attributes (LOAN-169).

id: desired result that a party envisions, plans, and to which it commits, in order to achieve a desired state
name: desired result that a party envisions, plans, and to which it commits, in order to achieve a desired state

id: relates something to a plan or method for achieving a specific goal, objective, solution or outcome
name: relates something to a plan or method for achieving a specific goal, objective, solution or outcome
